content: Extremely well written content which is worth your money to buy the complete version. Could give 6 stars if it was possible.
A great course, that teaches you to read and write in hiragana and Katakana.
I can't download it why??????? üò¢üòî
Absolutely great continuation on from the beginners app. Introduces all of the content in a very clear way and all of the grammar and use well explained examples.
What i see is that on Fire OS it is looking for the SD card, but not finding it ( because i opted to "adopt" that micro SD as internal memory. ) I will try moving it to the SD.
I love this app so far! Shout out to Chris Broad, Abroad in Japan, for recommending thisüòä
Absolutely love this app! Helped me eventually reach fluency. I wish I could find something even close to as good as this for Mandarin..
I love this app. Easy to use. Great for listening comprehension.
I found this app very helpful in my Japanese studies. I liked the mix of language and cultural lessons.

The authors of this app pack are real talents at keeping you involved throughout with fun, witty and friendly explanations. If other apps make you practise swimming at the surface, this app makes you dive and explore the sea ground. I especially like sentences being analysed by changing a single word and looking at the effect. My only wish: a more gradual vocabulary introduction and practise (maybe just 5 new words at a time) HJ Int has much more content than HJ. Now I am longing for HJ Adv! :-)

Just to clarify, this is a great product in terms of lesson format. But the app/server has a bug. Everything was fine up until yesterday and now it tells me it can't verify my licence. I have checked my Internet connection and restarted my phone to no avail. Are others facing this problem? Happy to give this a 5-star rating once resolved but for now it's deeply frustrating. Thanks.
Still a great great highly recommended.
The text-to-speech only works sometimes when you tap the text. It's the only bad thing about this application, but a very off-putting one.
Probably the best Japanese language teaching app out there. If you're a novice then start with Human Japanese Beginners. Heck, buy both apps! They're absolutely worth it!

I've been using this for the last 3 or so years, as even once complete, it is very useful to back through and revisit the pages you bookmark or redo the quizzes (where questions are some what randomised so you can't simply "remember" the order). I can honestly say, it has been by far THE most useful Japanese learning resource. THANK YOU so much to all involved in creating an producing the beat language learning tool in the world!

I have tried a lot of books, websites etc. for learning japanese. And i must say, this is THE BEST way to learn japanese grammer, each concept is presented so well and gives you a much deeper understanding of why the language is constructed the way it is than you get from other sources. i will be waiting for human japanese advanced ;) the only problem i have is that looking up something is a bit cumbersome as flipping through the pages is pretty slow.

I've recommended the first version app to about every person I know who's interested in learning Japanese. Of course when I finished the first one, I had to buy the second! No program has taught me more than the Human Japanese series. The lessons are great and everything has an explanation rather than leaving you to figure things out on your own. The quizzes are helpful and interactive and I love everything about this app. Absolute 10/10.

It deserves the 4.8 rating. The teaching method is very natural and there is lots of cultural insight that most apps don't have. Lots of things this app taught me that I was glad i knew when i went to Japan. One thing I would really like to see, however is a vocab catalogue -either in app or as a separate app with all the vocab covered and some Flash cards or something like that. The vocab is scattered throughout the chapters which komd of makes it hard to review. Hope to see an advanced app!

The best textbook I've encountered, and I've tried a few! I showed my friend the chapter I was on, I only had to read the hiragana and he actually learned Japanese from it! The pacing is just right to learn quick, but it let's you take time to actually learn!!
Another excellent app. Thank you for taking the time to put this together in a way that is easy to follow! „ÅÇ„Çä„Åå„Å®„ÅÜÔºÅÔºÅ I've recommended HJ to anyone that wants to learn Japanese.

I have bought both beginner and intermediate versions and love them! The grammar is very well explained and the cultural notes and the author's humor make studying a lot of fun. I recommend wholeheartedly!

Just like Human Japanese, the Intermediate version is a good resource for learning the language. But I would like for this app to be checked for bugs. Human Japanese as well. So that when I go to use it, my phone doesn't go black on me, preventing me from using my phone.

Even better than the first one. An actual Japanese course, not a few flashcards calling itself one. The chapter on „ÅØ vs. „Åå was brilliant. The kanji lessons are a little light, but it's not meant to be more than an intro. You'll need a separate course to learn kanji. As with the first, the end of chapter testing is a bit disappointing, but the rest of it is first rate!

Had this and the first app on my kindle fire and loved them. It's interactive and logically progressive while keeping a nice light tone. I would give it 5 stars if I could work out how to get the display out of landscape mode! To be fair it's the only slight bug in a really nice app.

Definitely the best app for learning japanese, I actually use it instead of 
just downloading it!

Loved this app, but suddenly it stopped working, it hangs up at "Checking 
SD Card" while trying to load.
I can not get into the app anymore, it stay's on checking SDcard
Great app... has everything you need to learn Japanese. Kindly do release the advanced version too !! :D
This is truly the best app for taking your Japanese learning to the next level and the way Kanji is explained here is far better than any other app out there!
Really great app for learning Japanese. Could be even better if there was an option to slow down the example sentences, they're a little bit too fast for me some of the time :(

„ÇÑ„Å£„ÅüÔºÅ I've started learning Japanese 10 years + ago, including 3 years at school, which did help immensely, but I kind of... Got stuck with the basic. The problem was mainly the difficulty of finding Japanese people online to talk to. I've picked it up a week or 2 ago and after finishing Duolingo first, I was not satisfied at all. I then bought this app, and I can say it is the best 12 euros I've spent in a long, long time.   My level of Japanese is skyrocketing and I can impossibly not study for at least 3 or 4 hours a day. I've reached chapter 20 now, and learning Japanese is getting more and more exciting, especially since I found a Japanese friend online recently with whom I can practice what I've learned.   If you are even only a little serious about learning Japanese, and you already have a basic understanding of grammar, and can read „Å≤„Çâ„Åå„Å™ and „Ç´„Çø„Ç´„Éä, do yourself a favor and buy this app.  If you have never learned Japanese before: I can imagine that the beginner app of Human Japanese is equally good.   The only thing missing to me is a way of practicing kanji writing in the app itself (apart from the stroke order quizes), but the sheer amount of clearly explained and often funny information more than makes up for this.   Thank you, Human Japanese. You're the best learning Japanese app there is.
Best tool for learning japanese I have come back to over and over again.
The most amazing thing ever.
Bought this because I liked the first one but it stated here that it should cost 450php but I was charged 550php.

It's good but overall app rating: OK (3 stars) I like every feature of this app, except that it's slow. For example, switching pages is slow, showing the next question in a question is slow, basically everything is. Also, can a syncing feature be implemented? I reset my phone every now and then, and on the first time I reset it having this app, I found that all of my notes are gone - I am already at chapter 10 when that happened, so having a syncing feature (or at least a backup feature) would be helpful. This app is quite expensive (overpriced for overall app quality), so maybe try to listen to user feedback. Thanks

Very good app. However it's not structured nearly as well as the first. There's not enough interactiveness as each chapter is something like 40 pages long. I would have given it 5 if i had never used duolingo

A great follow-up to the previous app. I'd very much like to see a continuation at some point, perhaps with a bit more focus on learning more Kanji as, towards the end, progress felt a bit slow in that regard. However, I can still confidently say that this is one of the best - if not THE best - apps for learning Japanese on on here. It is certainly the best I've come across, which is why the Beginner and Intermediate apps were truly worth paying for.   If you're still in doubt, try the demo versions. They'll give you a great idea of what to expect from both of the apps.

I have a suggestion. Please use kanji for the words in Vocab test. Assuming that the kanji was already learned for that specific chapter, it would be much better to present them that way. I'm kind of surprised because some words in the vocab tests were already taken in HJ1. It would make sense to represent them in their kanji forms in HJ2 vocab test.  I haven't finished the app yet. I'm still at chapter 14, but I find the app really helpful. I was able to build a solid foundation in a short amount of time. I hope I'd be able to see my suggestion as an update before I finish the app.

Immediately bought this app after finishing the first Human Japanese. I went from zero knowledge of the language to knowing how to create my own sentences, read and write (still working on the kanji.. but I have hiragana and katakana down) and having a good grasp of the grammar.  Human Japanese gave me the tools to use the language, rather than parrot canned phrases.  10/10  One suggestion: I would like to see a glossary.
This is the best way to learn Japanese! Brian Rak, please make a Human Japanese Advance!
A very good app. It has what most others don't: lots of examples. I Would love to see an advanced version

Explains language logic really well. My only suggestion is to have an audio reading out everything so that i don't have to be reading the entire time, and can listen to it and follow along. Also, during the homeworks, instead of saying yata! It should just say the word I've selected, right or wrong, so I can reinforce what I'm learning to read.
Great explanations, easy too understand those nuances that sometimes are difficult. Please make advanced japanese please

I love this app. It teaches not just grammar and vocabulary but gives a lot of useful cultural information. Two things I would like to see in future: 1. more options in the free quizes: I would like to be able to change the number of questions per quiz (when I'm trying to revise 10 questions is too few). 2. Vocab and kanji index: it would be nice to be able to see all the vocab and kanji for a chapter all together and see my progress with each one in the quizes.
This app is a result of a refined understanding of language acquisition and an obvious love of the Japanese language. A wonderful accomplishment.

There are truly no words to express how magnificent and utterly brilliant you put this learning app together. Throughout the entire time using this app it felt like there was a real mentor near me and guiding the confused me to understand the complex language of Japanese. I have finished beginner's book and on my way to the intermediate to further expand my knowledge, so I can one day be able to read, write, and speak Japanese proficiently without the use of a dictionary every time. Thank you very much!
The best Japanese language app I've found. I really hope you'll create an advanced version!
It's the best
Very, VERY well made app with relevant material.

The content download at the beginning always says I have no internet connection so it never starts, therefore the app is useless. Their website is down too which probably explains it. The first app is great, so I'll re-buy this if the site comes back and the download is confirmed working.

This app creates a new age in language learning apps! I have been taking a Japanese class for four years and could tell I had some missing gaps, so I got this app, and it's greatly helped me. It's basically a textbook app that teaches a lot of Japanese vocabulary, as well as some culture. The only tiny flaw is that there probably shouldn't been a little more Kanji, but it's still amazing and I hope that people who make other language apps look at this app and get ideas to make similar ones. Because as a guys who also studies Mandarin and Korean, as well as interested in a few others, my other languages are "jealous" of this app and hope they get their own version ; )
Wonderful learning experience. Well thought out and wonderfully explained. Bravo to the authors.
A great app for learning grammar. I really hope that the developer will consider making an advanced one as well!

One of the best learning apps, however the tests could be improved. If it had speed and vocab tests like Memrise, then I wouldn't skip the tests. I love how there's a breakdown of the sentences. Needs a dictionary for vocab and particles.

I like the app..i learned a lot of things about japan and nihongo. I hope you'l have an update on it adding more kanji characters or develope a new app/chapter that focuses on kanji or  aiming to prepare users for JLPT tests.
A great successor to the original Human Japanese app
Excellent
you should start it right away if you want to enjoy a perfect Japanese teaching app! :)

It really is a great app, but since Intermediate only got 1000 downloads I doubt you will make Advanced :( Thanks for the quality app! I only have one problem : every 3 weeks or so the app asks me to update the content, even though I think the app doesn't update anything.                                                PS : If you want to keep practicing your vocabulary from human japanese beginner, download the Ankidroid app and download the human japanese package, it's so good to keep your vocabulary fresh
Great photos and lessons that keep you interested in learning Japanese! Well worth the $$ „Åì„ÅÆ„Ç¢„Éó„É™„ÇíË≤∑„ÅÜ„Å¶‚ù£
Don't install the free one, buy this one. Dev team, please make the next sequel of Human Japanese. I've bought the first and this one and I don't mind paying more to learn more.
Obviously I have a Internet connection, but the app couldn't find it to download its startup package. I bought it after seeing the great reviews. I guess it is a scam.

This app is very well done and helpful. If you used the beginner version too then you probably don't need convincing, but if you're skipping strait to the intermediate app then know that it is definitely worth the price. My only suggestion to the devs is to have more frequent quizzes and maybe shorter chapters, and please make previous vocab and kanji quizzes more easily accessible.
As an English speaker this is very well put together, and feels like the author is talking directly to me.
Lol its been 2 yrs since i bought this ,still waiting for advanced, i bought both HJ beginner and intermediate ;) ,no regrets
Great app, no argument. Would be better if end of chapter reviews could randomly test knowledge from all previous chapters as well, to refresh the knowledge

No kidding, passed JLPT Dec N1 test with the help of this app. Amazingly well written studying material for nailing down the basics of Japanese. Couple it with some other vocabularies app and you will be ready for reading part of JLPT
Great explanations, great examples, covers a lot. Highly recommended!

Bought this as a Christmas present for myself.  If only I could give it more than five stars! It's cleverly written! The lessons are entertaining enough, it doesn't feel like I'm reading a text book. The interface is really simple and is the most polished for a learning app I've encountered so far.  My only regret is that I didn't read the whole Introduction in the Intermediate Lite version -  I haven't learned a few of the prerequisites needed by this version yet to ensure a completely seamless learning experience taught by another Japanese learning app.   Instead, I simply skimmed through the non-Intermediate version and this version's chapters to see the lessons that I thought I could skip.  I should've bought the first version. :-/  Over the confusion caused by Google Play's refund/uninstall process and thanks to my telecom provider's downtime, I'm stuck with this version.

This app (and previous one) have been so much fun to use for learning Japanese.  However I feel that the intermediate app would be greatly (and I mean GREATLY) benefited by having a kanji search function. Or even a way to easily review the kanji that youve already gone through WITHOUT having to go through pages and pages to find the reference material again.  DOnt get me wrong, these apps are amazing... this is just a feature I wouod live to see introduced! Thanks for all the hard work „Åå„Çì„Å∞„Å£„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ
This is by far the best app I have tried to keep up with studying. Completely worth the money.

I was a huge fan of the beginner app.  The style of interactive lessons combined with a bit of history and culture keeps it interesting and fun.  I've tried the first few intermediate chapters on PC already and love the improvements.  Am super excited to work through this.

This is one of the best ways to learn Japanese the way it is set up makes it seem as if someone is holding your hand while walking you trough the language. This app is the best 10$ i have ever spent probably in my life knowing what i know now about the app i would easily pay more to have it i really cant wait for the advanced version. My only improvement would be for the advanced to put in more kanji seeing as on a daily basis they use about 2000 in japan that would  be great, but nonetheless an amzing app

I have to say that I have tried tens of Japanese learning apps before falling on this absolute gem. It did seem oh so very hard to learn until this marvelous find! The author has a way with words and makes things seem easy enough that it becomes easily learnable. Believe it or not, I also learned things about English and it made me question languages in general! Lessons are well made, very clear and concise, quizzes are fun yet to the point and grammar is taught in a way that it sticks in your mind! The "bad" points? Ameliorations might include : Skipping through pages in a chapter, being able to rotate the app, ability to mute voices in quizzes, being able to take random quizzes to refresh memory and avoid device sleep when not touched for a while. Seriously, I barely ever rate apps but I felt the need to give the merit this one deserves. Well done, I am grateful for the opportunity to use this app.

The best app out there for furthering the study of Japanese. Make no mistake though, you really need to have completed the Beginners course before you tackle this one. Like the first app, the quizzes are an excellent addition which expose gaps in your knowledge and help you to progress. For serious learners, not for those who just want to ask for a cup of coffee in Tokyo!

This is the best Japanese course app that I had yet found. There is a lot of information packed in the app, however it is very accesable and somehow friendly. I only hope that the author comes out with Human Japanese Advanced.

I've read books, listened to audio courses, I've used everything. This is by far the best learning material I've ever used. He takes the time to really explain the grammar and the meanings in a clear concise way. I could not be happier. „ÅÇ„Çä„Åå„Å®„ÅÜ„Åî„Åñ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô

Hi I bought both Human Japanese app. It's no doubt the best app for learning Japanese.  I have one request - Even though you don't want to scare people off with Kanji at the beginning, I think people will not bother seeing it as long as it comes with Furigana and you can tell them not to bother with Kanji unless they obses with it (like me). For me I love to see Japanese sentence with Kanji. It's beautiful to see three of them together in one sentences.  I take serious of every example sentences you provide. I hear it, mimic it and write it. Whenever I will have finished Human Japanese Intermediate, Ill back to the start and Ill  be happy to see Kanji and it's time to be serious with them.  HOPE YOU CONSIDER THIS TO INGREDIENTS - NEED MORE KANJI. Thanks

I absolutely love this app, and the one before it "Human Japanese." These two apps propelled my Japanese learning ahead light years.  I refer back to them for refreshers, and love taking the quizzes.  It's the best way for self-learners to get that motivational bump ahead.  If the producer creates more advanced forms, I'll be buying all of them (ALL).  Lol.  Love these apps!

This was the best 10 or 20 bucks(I forgot how much it was) I've ever spent on Japanese learning software. This intermediate version explains more keys  point of Japanese than were covered in all 3 levels of Rosetta stone Japanese. There are tons of example and lots of quizzes. It will even get you reading and writing kanji (with proper stroke order!) Cant say enough good things about this app!
Well worth the money, can't wait for the advanced edition!
Definitely worth the buy. My Japanese has improved more than I could have imagined since purchasing it.

Excellent value for the money. The author has a distinct way of disarming the material so that it's not intimidating for "intermediate" learners. After just a few short chapters you will have a better understanding of dialogue from Anime, music and other media. I'm only a few chapters in so far but I've been studying Japanese a lone for a while. Well worth the $10!

Very easy to follow and an encouraging feeling of making progress. Just please add sound on/off to the preferences because I've been embarrassed by "Yatta!" now and then while taking quizzes on the train.
Very useful. Can't wait for the advanced level....
This is a great app! I can't complain. Every language learning app should teach like this.

Thanks to this app, when I went to Japan, I could have simple conversations. Knowing the kanji for big and small turned out to be useful with a toilet in a mountain inn. My only improvement would be to learn the vocabulary for kanji before being introduced to the character.

Would it be possible to add an option to turn all the vocab into kanji? I've studied over 900 kanji already and trying to read those long strings of kana is making me feel dizzy.... (not to mention the ridiculous number of homophones... *shudders*) I'm here for the grammar.Thanks! :)
Would be greater if I can jump through pages
You can feel a lot of work has been put into this, and it shows. I would really really like to be able to use the app in portrait mode though.

Wonderfully clear, informative and easy to use app. This is the most complete learning experience amongst all the apps I have tried. Please, please bring out more advanced ones. Thank you for your efforts
My second most successful Japanese learning experience after the first human Japanese
Add a dictionary, a comprehensive grammar guide, and something for immersion and you are all set. Direct continuation to the first part.

I have tried to find a good intermediate level Japanese course, and failed... until now! It is so easy to read, and easy to remember! The teaching style is very good! I love it, and recommend it if you are beyond the beginner stage, and ready to step it up. :) Worth the purchase!
Awesome

After being frustrated with a seemingly endless number of "language teaching" apps that end up being nothing but simple flash-card tests with no actual text content to explain new concepts, I was happy to discover this app. Human Japanese presents the lesson material just as thoroughly as my college textbooks did, and the author writes in a nice relaxed style to keep the material interesting. The interactive example sentences, quizzes, and kanji tools placed in-line with the lesson text make it easy to immediately practice new concepts. The fact that this app is only $10 makes it a no-brainer to me.

I have used tons of different translation tools from My Japanese Coach for the Nintendo DS to the Internet in desperation to learn basic Kanji, i even tried learning how to translate words without Google translate all the time, but to no evail. But this program by far helped me the most and I'm only at chapter 2! Bought the other version not knowing about intermediate, but still bought this happily to learn more indepth Japanese <3 (Turns out intermediate takes off after the normal version, so happy!!!)
Very poor and slow connection to download its data
This app has taught me all the basic concepts I need to know to make my way towards fluency.
Though english is not my mother language, I found HJ very easy to read, informative, fun, and addictive! Great app for learning Japanese! Please create HJ advance and I'll definitely buy it.

So happy you have the next step!   Well worth the price. I can learn at my own pace and still have a natural understanding of how the language works.  It's not stilted or rote.  When an advanced is available I'll nab it immediately.   I highly recommend.

Still just starting out in Japanese, but i bought human Japanese intermediate after 20 minutes of using the beginner course - how could i not? B-Rak and the rest of the team have nailed it...excited to keep learning. Cheers guys.
the human japanese is the best japanese learning app series! written in a entertaining way you never get bored!

I have a trouble with reviews: they are unable to pass because review windows are completely empty. I can see white boxes for text moving at start but they are blank. I can click and hear a reaction voice, and even complete the review but do it in a blind way. :( I use Sony Xperia Ray.  Upd.: found a temporary solution for anyone faced same trouble: it is possible to start review by starting it just after opening first page of any chapter via chapters menu. Do not scroll it though.
replyContent: Hello Gave, sorry to hear about the trouble. This is the first we've heard of this issue. We'll investigate and see what we can figure out. Thanks for letting us know!

content: Worth the 3 year wait. :-D
Just hope it's lighter somehow
Just finished my first year of self taught Japanese study. HJ and HJ intermediate have been invaluable resources. I could not recommend them more.
Love this app, really explains everything perfectly, now I can't wait for the advanced one to arrive :P
Hope some of these advancements make their way to the beginner app. Much improved!
replyContent: Erik, we are currently refreshing the Intro app and will indeed be including many of the improvements we made in Intermediate. We hope to have the update ready for download within a few months. Stay tuned!

content: „Çè„Åü„Åó „ÅØ „Éí„É•„Éº„Éû„É≥ „Ç∏„É£„Éë„Éã„Éº„Ç∫ „ÇÑ„Å£„Å® „Åã„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„ÅüÔºÅ „ÅÇ„Çä„Åå„Å®„ÅÜ „Åî„Åñ„ÅÑ„Åæ„ÅôÔºÅ And if I said that correctly, I am ready to take on intermediate.  ;)

Human Japanese will take you on a magic carpet into the fabulous world of Japanese! The app will help you build your new language from the very ground up in a unprecedented and incredibly fun way. All the material is clearly and thoroughly explained by discussions, examples and even dialogs with native Japanese speakers! The app is absolutely worth every penny you spend on it, and believe me, if you are truly willing to learn, this is the app for you.
